lead_paragraph: Q: You made a fortune financing start-up firms like Hotmail. Now you're plunking down $20 million of your money to support a November ballot measure that would give all California schoolkids a $4,000 voucher to use at the school of their choice. That's $20 million just to support the initiative, not to build new schools or anything. Why? I felt somebody had to stand up for the kids and say, Hey, something's wrong. Our educational system is failing us. It's time for a change.
abstract: Interview with Silicon Valley venture capitalist Tim Draper, who explains why he plans to invest $20 million to support California's school voucher measure; photo (M)
